body_html:
@ezyang looks like those tests were not being skipped in the previous builds.
This issue I believe is just a matter of fixing the tests so that Windows is happy with it (as was the case for the py2 fixes).
I currently have no idea where to look at (I was thinking that maybe it was a problem in here?), and I don't have a Windows machine to try it out.

A few options:

  • revert the tests to what they were before (and given that tests pass in all other architectures, that might reassure Peter that it's possible to have extensions in nested namespaces)
  • skip this test for Windows (bad)
  • try to debug with the help of @peterjc123
  • drop this patch (nooooo!!!)

body:
@ezyang looks like those tests were not being skipped in the previous builds.
This issue I believe is just a matter of fixing the tests so that Windows is happy with it (as was the case for the py2 fixes).
I currently have no idea where to look at (I was thinking that maybe it was a problem in [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/run_test.py#L97-L108)?), and I don't have a Windows machine to try it out.

A few options:
- revert the tests to what they were before (and given that tests pass in all other architectures, that might reassure Peter that it's possible to have extensions in nested namespaces)
- skip this test for Windows (bad)
- try to debug with the help of @peterjc123
- drop this patch (nooooo!!!)
